snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton’s blood clot formed in her head, her doctors said on Monday, a potentially serious condition from which they nonetheless expect her to fully recover.
abstract: Doctors say blood clot that formed in Sec of State Hillary Rodham Clinton's head posed potentially serious condition from which they nonetheless expect her to fully recover; Clinton was hospitalized at New York-Presbyterian Hospital for clot, which is in a vein between the brain and skull and behind her right ear.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and DENISE GRADY
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Denise Grady from New York. Lawrence K. Altman contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton’s blood clot formed in her head, her doctors said on Monday, a potentially serious condition from which they nonetheless expect her to fully recover.

headline.main: Doctors Expect Clinton to Recover Fully From Blood Clot Near Brain
headline.print_headline: Doctors Expect Clinton to Recover Fully From Blood Clot Near Brain
